intro: Neopicrorhiza scrophulariiflora, commonly known as Chinese valerian, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is valued for its aromatic roots, which contain compounds used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and pharmacological contexts.
